title: [IAB-5521] Video Highlights popover should not display on paywall during initial launch
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and this is the initial launch of the app
custom_steps: When the app is launched
custom_expected:
Then the user should not see the highlights popover on the paywall

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5521

title: [IAB-5523] Info Popover should be correctly placed
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and this is the initial install
and the user has selected a favorite team
custom_steps: When the user navigates to their favorite team's page by clicking on the icon in the navigation bar
custom_expected:
Then the info popover should be pointing to the MLB.com icon in the upper left corner

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5523

title: [IAB-5534] There should only be one info popover when launching a favorite team page for the first time
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and this will be the initial launch of the app
and the user clicks to add a favorite team
and the user navigates to their favorite teams page for the first time
custom_steps: When this page loads
custom_expected:
Then there should only be one info popover at the top of the screen directing the user that they can change teams by clicking on the MLB.com icon at the top left of the screen

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5534

title: [IAB-5534] There should not be a crash when the info popover is present and the user taps in an area where there are no links
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and this will be their initial launch of the app
and the user selects a favorite team
and the user navigates to their favorite team's page
custom_steps:
When the page loads
and the info popover is present 
and the user clicks at the bottom of the screen where there are no links present \
custom_expected:
Then the app will not crash
and the info popover will close 

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5534

title: [IAB-5149] Back Button should display the name of the team
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has clicked on More
and the user has clicked on Teams
and the user clicks on a team
custom_steps: When the user clicks News
custom_expected:
Then the back button on the News page should contain the name of the team
and the entire name should fit within the contents of the back button
and this should be repeated for all 30 teams.


Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5149

title: [IAB-5209] Tapping on two news article at once should not crash the app
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has clicked on the News/Video menu button
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the first article (first referring to the first article they choose, not to the first article in the news index) 
and presses
and holds that article in a depressed state
and while that article is in a depressed state the user taps on the second article (again second is referring to the second article they choose, not to the second article in news index)
custom_expected:
Then the app should not crash 

Repete: A few times as this crash only happened about 75% of the time. 

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5209

title: [IAB-4931] iOS 6 pull to refresh news
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user is using an iOS 6 device
and the user has clicked on the News/Video menu item
custom_steps: When the user pulls down the news index
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a refresh occurring 

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-4931

title: [IAB-5514] Video search should retain search state after viewing a searched video
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has logged in with an entitled Account
and the user has clicked on the More tab
and the user has clicked on 'Teams' 
and the user clicks on a team from the list
and the user clicks on 'Video'
and the user clicks in the search box to search for a video
and the the user enters an input
and the user searches for that input
and the result list is returned
and the user clicks on a video from the list returned
custom_steps: When the user either completes the video or the user clicks done
custom_expected:
Then the list of videos the user should be viewing should be the list of videos returned form the users' search 
and not the original list
and not a prior search result set

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5514

title: [IAB-5116] Video search results should match the first 25 web results
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has an app entitled account
and the user has clicked on News/Video from the tab bar
and the user has clicked on Highlights
and at the same time the user has navigated to the desktop site's video page
custom_steps:
When the user enters in a query in both the search box on the app
and in the search box on the desktop site
custom_expected:
Then all the mobile results should match the first n "25" results from the web search.

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5116

When the user clicks on MLB.TV from the bottom navigation bar
and the user scrolls back to a date which their is an archive feed present
and the user clicks to play the archive feed

and the user should not be brought to an 'access issue' page

title: [IAB-5502] iOS6 Location error Text

and the user is logged in with an MLB.TV entitled account
and the user has location services turned off/disabled
custom_steps:
When the user clicks on the MLB.TV button 
and the user launches a stream
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the location error screen
and the error text will read "At Bat is currently unable to verify your location. To ensure location services are enabled, go to iPhone Settings > Privacy > Location Services and make sure At Bat is set to On."

custom_steps: When the user clicks the 'Classics' segmented control
custom_expected:
Then the list of videos here should match the index at (http://qa.mlb.com/gen/multimedia/videolist/at_bat_classic.xml)

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5491

title: [IAB-5491] No MLB.TV overlays
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has logged in to an app entitled account
and the user has clicked on the MLB.TV drop down at the top of the screen
and the user has clicked the Classics segmented control
custom_steps: When the user clicks on a feed to launch
custom_expected:
Then the feed will launch
and their will be no MLB.TV overlays present

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5491

title: [IAB-5530] Tapping on the classics segmented control should not switch the modal to portrait mode when the modal is reopened
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user is using a pre-iOS6 ipad
and the user has clicked on the MLB.TV drop down
custom_steps:
When the user clicks on the Classics Segmented Control 
and closes the modal
and opens the modal again
custom_expected:
Then the modal should still not switch to portrait mode in relation to the ipad

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5530

title: [IAB-5532] Padding on classic games view
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has clicked on the MLB.TV drop down
custom_steps: When the user clicks the Classics segmented control
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the classic games in this view
and there will be a padding around the view of 6 pixels 

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5532

title: [IAB-5383] Screen-size toggle should be present on all devices
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and their is at least one highlight available
and the user clicks the MLB.com drop down
and the user clicks the scoreboard cell
and the user clicks on a completed game
and the user clicks the Highlights tab
custom_steps: When the user clicks on a highlight to play
custom_expected:
Then the highlight will begin to play
and the user will see a screen-size toggle 
and this toggle will control the size of the player (increasing and decreasing the size)

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5383

title: [IAB-5383] Screen-size toggle should be present on all devices
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and their is a live look-in available
custom_steps: When the user clicks on the live look-in
custom_expected:
Then the video will begin playing
and their will be a screen size toggle button
and this toggle will control the size of the video (increasing and decreasing the size)

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5383

title: [IAB-5211] Team Schedules should be bound to the current end of season.
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user is using an iOS6 device
and the user has clicked on the MLB.com drop down
and the user has clicked the Team Schedules cell
and the user has selected a team from the left hand side
custom_steps: When the user tries to swipe past the end of the current season
custom_expected:
Then the schedule should NOT allow the user to swipe past the current end of the season.

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5211

title: [IAB-5211] Team Schedules should be bound to the current start of season.
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user is using an iOS6 device
and the user has clicked on the MLB.com drop down
and the user has clicked the Team Schedules cell
and the user has selected a team from the left hand side
custom_steps: When the user tries to swipe to a date before the current season began
custom_expected:
Then the schedule should NOT allow the user to swipe to a date prior to the start of the season

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5211

title: [IAB-5163] Paging forward on iOS6 should not crash the app
custom_preconds:
Given The user has installed At Bat
and the user's OS is iOS6
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the MLB.com icon at the top left of the screen
and the user selects Team Schedules
and the user selects a team from the list of teams
and the user swipes the calendar forward (provided their is a forward month to swipe to)
custom_expected:
Then the app will not crash
and the user will be one month forward

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5163

title: [IAB-5163] Paging backward on iOS6 should not crash the app
custom_preconds:
Given The user has installed At Bat
and the user's OS is iOS6
custom_steps:
When the user clicks the MLB.com icon at the top left of the screen
and the user selects Team Schedules
and the user selects a team from the list of teams
and the user swipes the calendar backward (provided that their is a backward month to swipe to)
custom_expected:
Then the app will not crash
and the user will be on the prior month

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5163

title: [IAB-5212] Paging should never result in a blank schedule page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has clicked on the MLB.com icon button
and the user has clicked on Team Schedules
and the user has selected a team from the left hand side
custom_steps:
When the team schedule loads
and the user pages through the schedule
custom_expected:
Then the schedule should never resolve to a blank page

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5212

title: [IAB-5173] Navigating back to settings on a settings subview when the keyboard is open
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user is using an iOS6 device
and the user has clicked on the settings gear
and the user has clicked on the MLB.com Account cell
and the user has clicked in the email or password field
custom_steps: When the user clicks the Settings back arrow
custom_expected:
Then the user should be returned to the Settings screen
and not be on the MLB.com Account screen
and the keyboard should be hidden again.

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5173

title: [IAB-5515] At Bat paywall should appear for lite users trying to launch a classic game
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user is a lite user
and the user clicks on the MLB.TV drop down at the top of the screen
and the user clicks on the Classics segmented control
custom_steps: When the user clicks on a game to launch it
custom_expected:
Then the At Bat paywall should appear
and not the MLB.TV paywall
and the user should not be able to access this content while being a lite user

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5515

title: [IAB-5516] At Bat paywall should appear for lite users trying to launch an archive feed
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user is a lite user
and the user clicks on the MLB.TV drop down at the top of the screen
and the user clicks on the MLB.TV segmented control
and the user scrolls to a date where their are archive feeds for that date
custom_steps: When the user clicks on an archive feed to launch it
custom_expected:
Then the user will be given the At Bat paywall
and the user will not be given the MLB.TV paywall
and a lite user will not have access to this content 

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5516

title: [IAB-5017] Boxscore should default to the top of the view every time
custom_preconds:
Given the user has installed At Bat
and the user has launched At Bat
and the user has logged in with an app entitled account
and the user has clicked the MLB.com drop down
and the user clicks on the Gameday cell
and the user clicks on a game from the out of town scoreboard
and the user clicks the box score tab on this game
and the user scrolls to the bottom of this view
and the user backs out back to the Gameday view
and the user clicks on a different game
custom_steps: When the user clicks on the box score tab
custom_expected:
Then the view will load
and the user's location will be at the top of the view

Reference: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-5017
